intro: Allium suaveolens subsp. serotinum, commonly known as the late garlic or serotinum garlic, is a member of the Amaryllidaceae family. It is a perennial herb characterized by its bulbous structure and grass-like leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in late summer to early autumn. It is native to regions of southern Europe and is often found in rocky or dry habitats. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ornamental plant in horticultural settings.
